 function _go(url, newWindow) {
 if (newWindow)
 window.open(url, '_blank');
 else
 document.location = url;
 }
 function $(id) { return document.getElementById(id); }
 var loadQueue = [];
 function runOnLoad(fn) { loadQueue.push(fn); }
 window.onload = function() {
 for (var i = 0; i < loadQueue.length; i++)
 loadQueue[i]();
 delete loadQueue;
 };

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);

  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;

    background: none;

        <h2>
          Issue tracker keyboard shortcuts
          <button class="close-button">
            Close
          </button>
        </h2>
        
          
            
              <span></span>Issue list<span class="help-title"><!---->Issue list<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    k<kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  
                    j<kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                up/down in the list<span class="key-tip"><!---->up/down in the list<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    o<kbd><!---->o<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  
                    Enter<kbd><!---->Enter<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->o<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                open the current issue<span class="key-tip"><!---->open the current issue<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    Shift-O<kbd><!---->Shift-O<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>
      
          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 89.0.4357.0 (Developer Build) (x86_64)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 89.0.4357.0 (Developer Build) (x86_64)<!----></span><br>Operating System: MacOS<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: MacOS<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Go to <span class="line"><!---->1. Go to <!----></span>https://skilful-reserve-239412.appspot.com/static/apps/navigation-tester<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://skilful-reserve-239412.appspot.com/static/apps/navigation-tester"><!---->https://skilful-reserve-239412.appspot.com/static/apps/navigation-tester<!----></a> and install "Max Payment Method"<span class="line"><!----> and install "Max Payment Method"<!----></span><br>1. Go to <span class="line"><!---->1. Go to <!----></span>https://maxlgu.github.io/pr/max-nonbasiccard/<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://maxlgu.github.io/pr/max-nonbasiccard/"><!---->https://maxlgu.github.io/pr/max-nonbasiccard/<!----></a><br>2. Click on "Busy" button.<span class="line"><!---->2. Click on "Busy" button.<!----></span><br>3. In payment dialog try to change <span class="line"><!---->3. In payment dialog try to change <!----></span>http://www.google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://www.google.com"><!---->http://www.google.com<!----></a> to <span class="line"><!----> to <!----></span>https://lbstyle.github.io/chromeUrls.pdf<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://lbstyle.github.io/chromeUrls.pdf"><!---->https://lbstyle.github.io/chromeUrls.pdf<!----></a> then click on "Go!" button.<span class="line"><!----> then click on "Go!" button.<!----></span><br>4. Click on the link <span class="line"><!---->4. Click on the link <!----></span><br><br>Actual: Observe that <span class="line"><!---->Actual: Observe that <!----></span>https://lbstyle.github.io<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://lbstyle.github.io"><!---->https://lbstyle.github.io<!----></a> URL displayed but the content area still shows<span class="line"><!----> URL displayed but the content area still shows<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://google.com"><!---->google.com<!----></a> contents.<span class="line"><!----> contents.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Agreed that opening a PDF in the payment handler window should be disabled as one mitigation.<span class="line"><!---->Agreed that opening a PDF in the payment handler window should be disabled as one mitigation.<!----></span><br><br>Another mitigation is to figure out which method in WebContentsObserver and WebContentsDelegate the code needs to override to detect the URL change:<span class="line"><!---->Another mitigation is to figure out which method in WebContentsObserver and WebContentsDelegate the code needs to override to detect the URL change:<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/payments/payment_handler_web_flow_view_controller.h;l=72-88;drc=da37bf24c7c0f86579b4bb18ad85c5a906dcf88f<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/payments/payment_handler_web_flow_view_controller.h;l=72-88;drc=da37bf24c7c0f86579b4bb18ad85c5a906dcf88f"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/payments/payment_handler_web_flow_view_controller.h;l=72-88;drc=da37bf24c7c0f86579b4bb18ad85c5a906dcf88f<!----></a><br><br>At this point, the code updates he URL on DidStartNavigation() and DidFinishNavigation(). Which method gets triggered when a URL is opened from a PDF?<span class="line"><!---->At this point, the code updates he URL on DidStartNavigation() and DidFinishNavigation(). Which method gets triggered when a URL is opened from a PDF?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        PDFs on desktop load in a GuestView, which has an inner WebContents separate from the top-level WebContents.  Normally, though, navigations in a PDF get intercepted and targeted at the top-level WebContents, causing the entire inner WebContents to go away rather than navigate.  You can verify this by clicking the link in the PDF after visiting <span class="line"><!---->PDFs on desktop load in a GuestView, which has an inner WebContents separate from the top-level WebContents.  Normally, though, navigations in a PDF get intercepted and targeted at the top-level WebContents, causing the entire inner WebContents to go away rather than navigate.  You can verify this by clicking the link in the PDF after visiting <!----></span>https://lbstyle.github.io/chromeUrls.pdf<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://lbstyle.github.io/chromeUrls.pdf"><!---->https://lbstyle.github.io/chromeUrls.pdf<!----></a> in a normal tab.<span class="line"><!----> in a normal tab.<!----></span><br><br>I'm curious why that isn't happening in the Payments WebContents.  Agreed that it should be fixed, and it may make sense to block PDFs entirely within the Payments WebContents to be safe on top of that.<span class="line"><!---->I'm curious why that isn't happening in the Payments WebContents.  Agreed that it should be fixed, and it may make sense to block PDFs entirely within the Payments WebContents to be safe on top of that.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        Note that blocking PDFs in Payments WebContents may be useful, but I suspect this bug would also apply to many other non-tab WebContents use cases, so it may not be sufficient.<span class="line"><!---->Note that blocking PDFs in Payments WebContents may be useful, but I suspect this bug would also apply to many other non-tab WebContents use cases, so it may not be sufficient.<!----></span><br><br>I'm curious if the PDF extension's approach for handling navigations within the PDF needs to be hardened to not rely on the embedder.  For example, kmoon@ points to this code as one place that might be involved:<span class="line"><!---->I'm curious if the PDF extension's approach for handling navigations within the PDF needs to be hardened to not rely on the embedder.         That navigator.js code does look suspicious:<span class="line"><!---->That navigator.js code does look suspicious:<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/resources/pdf/navigator.js;drc=a9c450d1237c78cfcf93603697c9972f7adf5187;l=43<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/resources/pdf/navigator.js;drc=a9c450d1237c78cfcf93603697c9972f7adf5187;l=43"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/resources/pdf/navigator.js;drc=a9c450d1237c78cfcf93603697c9972f7adf5187;l=43<!----></a><br><br>  navigateInCurrentTab: function(url) {<span class="line"><!---->  navigateInCurrentTab: function(url) {<!----></span><br>    // When the PDFviewer is inside a browser tab, prefer the tabs API because<span class="line"><!---->    // When the PDFviewer is inside a browser tab, prefer the tabs API because<!----></span><br>    // it can navigate from one file:// URL to another.<span class="line"><!---->    // it can navigate from one file:// URL to another.<!----></span><br>    if (chrome.tabs && this.tabId_ != -1)<span class="line"><!---->    if (chrome.tabs &amp;&amp; this.tabId_ != -1)<!----></span><br>      chrome.tabs.update(this.tabId_, {url: url});<span class="line"><!---->      chrome.tabs.update(this.tabId_, {url: url});<!----></span><br>    else<span class="line"><!---->    else<!----></span><br>      window.location.href = url;<span class="line"><!---->      window.location.href = url;<!----></span><br>  },<span class="line"><!---->  },<!----></span><br><br><br>If the conditional fails, then we hit the window.location.href = url line, which is a recipe for this URL spoof.  Probably dates back to <span class="line"><!---->If the conditional fails, then we hit the window.location.href = url line, which is a recipe for this URL spoof.  Probably dates back to <!----></span>https://codereview.chromium.org/2300243004<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://codereview.chromium.org/2300243004"><!---->https://codereview.chromium.org/2300243004<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>I wonder if PDF folks can remove that else, first of all.  We probably never want to navigate the inner WebContents.  Whether chrome.tabs should work in the Payments case is a separate question, and it may be that we don't want it to.<span class="line"><!---->I wonder if PDF folks can remove that else, first of all.  We probably never want to navigate the inner WebContents.  Whether chrome.tabs should work in the Payments case is a separate question, and it may be that we don't want it to.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Dec 17, 2020, 11:51 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>

      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        The decision as to whether or not a URL is opened as a PDF isn't made until the URL response headers (Content-Type) are received. (We don't know the true MIME type of the response until this point; actually, we even sniff a few bytes of the response body in some cases.) WillStartRequest() is too early in the navigation flow to detect if you're navigating to a PDF. (The request hasn't been issued yet.)<span class="line"><!---->The decision as to whether or not a URL is opened as a PDF isn't made until the URL response headers (Content-Type) are received. (We don't know the true MIME type of the response until this point; actually, we even sniff a few bytes of the response body in some cases.) WillStartRequest() is too early in the navigation flow to detect if you're navigating to a PDF. (The request hasn't been issued yet.)<!----></span><br><br>For example, see PDFIFrameNavigationThrottle and PluginResponseInterceptorURLLoaderThrottle.<span class="line"><!---->For example, see PDFIFrameNavigationThrottle and PluginResponseInterceptorURLLoaderThrottle.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2" commenterismember=""></mr-comment>

        Ah, turns out I should use WillProcessResponse() instead. navigation_handle()->GetResponseHeaders()->GetMimeType(&mime_type)  returns the right type.<span class="line"><!---->Ah, turns out I should use WillProcessResponse() instead. navigation_handle()-&gt;GetResponseHeaders()-&gt;GetMimeType(&amp;mime_type)  returns the right type.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

        One more thing: The PDF viewer actually isn't the only extension that makes use of MimeHandlerView and its associated infrastructure. It's also used by the (formerly) QuickOffice extension (used to view Office file types), so it might be worthwhile to make sure a similar issue can't occur with that extension.<span class="line"><!---->One more thing: The PDF viewer actually isn't the only extension that makes use of MimeHandlerView and its associated infrastructure. It's also used by the (formerly) QuickOffice extension (used to view Office file types), so it might be worthwhile to make sure a similar issue can't occur with that extension.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        You probably want to check if the MIME type would be handled by an extension. This is the most "future proof" approach.<span class="line"><!---->You probably want to check if the MIME type would be handled by an extension. This is the most "future proof" approach.<!----></span><br><br>There's an allow list of extensions that are allowed to register MIME type handlers:<span class="line"><!---->There's an allow list of extensions that are allowed to register MIME type handlers:<!----></span><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:extensions/common/manifest_handlers/mime_types_handler.cc;l=29;drc=06805e7f64715706c1cf0dad0b04f481b0eda70c<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:extensions/common/manifest_handlers/mime_types_handler.cc;l=29;drc=06805e7f64715706c1cf0dad0b04f481b0eda70c"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:extensions/common/manifest_handlers/mime_types_handler.cc;l=29;drc=06805e7f64715706c1cf0dad0b04f481b0eda70c<!----></a><br><br>I would take a step back and ask if this is the right approach, though. Maybe allow listing specific navigations is what you really want, rather than banning certain kinds of navigations? Or we can just fix the bug in the PDF viewer.<span class="line"><!---->I would take a step back and ask if this is the right approach, though. Maybe allow listing specific navigations is what you really want, rather than banning certain kinds of navigations? Or we can just fix the bug in the PDF viewer.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>

      Thu, Dec 17, 2020, 2:27 PM EST
    <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Dec 17, 2020, 2:27 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          Project Member<span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1159267#c35">Comment 35<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Dec 17, 2020, 2:27 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1159267#c35">Comment 35<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Dec 17, 2020, 2:27 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        These are defined by the mime_types field in the extension's manifest.json. There's no limit on which MIME types an extension can claim, so it's better not to hard-code a list of MIME types. I'd look at PluginResponseInterceptorURLLoaderThrottle for inspiration.<span class="line"><!---->These are defined by the mime_types field in the extension's manifest.json. There's no limit on which MIME types an extension can claim, so it's better not to hard-code a list of MIME types. I'd look at PluginResponseInterceptorURLLoaderThrottle for inspiration.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

This CL disallows this behaviours to avoid any PDF-related<span class="line"><!---->support. This CL disallows this behaviours to avoid any PDF-related<!----></span><br>risks.<span class="line"><!---->risks.<!----></span><br><br>Before this CL, the WebContents in desktop PaymentHandler UI could<span class="line"><!---->Before this CL, the WebContents in desktop PaymentHandler UI could<!----></span><br>navigate to a pdf file.<span class="line"><!---->navigate to a pdf file.<!----></span><br><br>After the CL, the WebContents could not navigate to PDF file.<span class="line"><!---->After the CL, the WebContents could not navigate to PDF file.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1159267<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1159267" title="Security: URL bar spoofing in Payments API"><!---->Bug: This<span class="line"><!---->Now, payment handler supports pages of any mime type on Android. This<!----></span><br>exposes payment handlers to the vulnerabilities of some less maintained<span class="line"><!---->exposes payment handlers to the vulnerabilities of some less maintained<!----></span><br>mime-types. In order to make payment handlers safer to use, this CL<span class="line"><!---->mime-types. In order to make payment handlers safer to use, this CL<!----></span><br>limits the mime types of payment handlers on Android by allowlisting.<span class="line"><!---->limits the mime types of payment handlers on Android by allowlisting.<!----></span><br><br>Changes:<span class="line"><!---->Changes:<!----></span><br>* Moved the WebContents user data setting logic into<span class="line"><!---->* Moved the WebContents user data setting logic into<!----></span><br>  markPaymentHandlerWebContents() to<span class="line"><!---->  markPaymentHandlerWebContents() to<!----></span><br>  payment_handler_navigation_throttle.cc.<span class="line"><!---->  payment_handler_navigation_throttle.cc.<!----></span><br>* Let both Android & desktop's payment handler coordinators use the<span class="line"><!---->* Let both Android &amp; desktop's payment handler coordinators use the<!----></span><br>  method to annotate a payment handler web-contents.<span class="line"><!---->  method to annotate a payment handler web-contents.<!----></span><br>* Moved the throttle from //chrome/browser to //components to make it<span class="line"><!---->* Moved the throttle from //chrome/browser to //components to make it<!----></span><br>  more convenient to depend on.<span class="line"><!---->  more convenient to depend on.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1165367<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1165367" title="Allowlist Payment Handler mime-types"><!---->Bug: 1165367<!----></a>, <span class="line"><!---->, <!----></span>1159267<a This<span class="line"><!---->Now, payment handler supports pages of any mime type on Android. This<!----></span><br>exposes payment handlers to the vulnerabilities of some less maintained<span class="line"><!---->exposes payment handlers to the vulnerabilities of some less maintained<!----></span><br>mime-types. In order to make payment handlers safer to use, this CL<span class="line"><!---->mime-types. In order to make payment handlers safer to use, this CL<!----></span><br>limits the mime types of payment handlers on Android by allowlisting.<span class="line"><!---->limits the mime types of payment handlers on Android by allowlisting.<!----></span><br><br>Changes:<span class="line"><!---->Changes:<!----></span><br>* Moved the WebContents user data setting logic into<span class="line"><!---->* Moved the WebContents user data setting logic into<!----></span><br>  markPaymentHandlerWebContents() to<span class="line"><!---->  markPaymentHandlerWebContents() to<!----></span><br>  payment_handler_navigation_throttle.cc.<span class="line"><!---->  payment_handler_navigation_throttle.cc.<!----></span><br>* Let both Android & desktop's payment handler coordinators use the<span class="line"><!---->* Let both Android &amp; desktop's payment handler coordinators use the<!----></span><br>  method to annotate a payment handler web-contents.<span class="line"><!---->  method to annotate a payment handler web-contents.<!----></span><br>* Moved the throttle from //chrome/browser to //components to make it<span class="line"><!---->* Moved the throttle from //chrome/browser to //components to make it<!----></span><br>  more convenient to depend on.<span class="line"><!---->  more convenient to depend on.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

         * is disabled for this component.

        for LitElement.

      <style>

          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);

          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

      </style>
      
      
    <!----></mr-launch-overview>
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>

        <mr-move-copy-issue id="move-copy-issue"></mr-move-copy-issue>

        <mr-related-issues id="reorder-related-issues"></mr-related-issues>

    <!----></mr-issue-page>

 function _go(url, newWindow) {
 if (newWindow)
 window.open(url, '_blank');
 else
 document.location = url;
 }
 function $(id) { return document.getElementById(id); }
 var loadQueue = [];

 for (var i = 0; i < loadQueue.length; i++)
 loadQueue[i]();
 delete loadQueue;
 };
</script>

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

                    <kbd><!---->x<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->select the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Issue details<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->prev/next issue in list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->u<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->up to issue list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->r<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->reply to current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Ctrl+Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->⌘+Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->save issue reply (submit issue on issue filing page)<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Anywhere<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->/<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->focus on the issue search field<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->c<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->compose a new issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->s<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->star the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->?<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->show this help dialog<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
        </div>
        
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        <p>
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        </p>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

              </mr-issue-link>

            <!---->
          </div>

      VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 89.0.4357.0 (Developer Build) (x86_64)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 89.0.4357.0 (Developer Build) (x86_64)<!----></span><br>Operating System: MacOS<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: MacOS<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Go to <span class="line"><!---->1. Go to <!----></span>https://skilful-reserve-239412.appspot.com/static/apps/navigation-tester<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://skilful-reserve-239412.appspot.com/static/apps/navigation-tester"><!---->https://skilful-reserve-239412.appspot.com/static/apps/navigation-tester<!----></a> and install "Max Payment Method"<span class="line"><!----> and install "Max Payment Method"<!----></span><br>1. Go to <span class="line"><!---->1. Go to <!----></span>https://maxlgu.github.io/pr/max-nonbasiccard/<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://maxlgu.github.io/pr/max-nonbasiccard/"><!---->https://maxlgu.github.io/pr/max-nonbasiccard/<!----></a><br>2. Click on "Busy" button.<span class="line"><!---->2. Click on "Busy" button.<!----></span><br>3. In payment dialog try to change <span class="line"><!---->3. In payment dialog try to change <!----></span>http://www.google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://www.google.com"><!---->http://www.google.com<!----></a> to <span class="line"><!----> to <!----></span>https://lbstyle.github.io/chromeUrls.pdf<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://lbstyle.github.io/chromeUrls.pdf"><!---->https://lbstyle.github.io/chromeUrls.pdf<!----></a> then click on "Go!" button.<span class="line"><!----> then click on "Go!" button.<!----></span><br>4. Click on the link <span class="line"><!---->4. Click on the link <!----></span><br><br>Actual: Observe that <span class="line"><!---->Actual: Observe that <!----></span>https://lbstyle.github.io<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://lbstyle.github.io"><!---->https://lbstyle.github.io<!----></a> URL displayed but the content area still shows<span class="line"><!----> URL displayed but the content area still shows<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://google.com"><!---->google.com<!----></a> contents.<span class="line"><!----> contents.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        PDFs on desktop load in a GuestView, which has an inner WebContents separate from the top-level WebContents.  Normally, though, navigations in a PDF get intercepted and targeted at the top-level WebContents, causing the entire inner WebContents to go away rather than navigate.  You can verify this by clicking the link in the PDF after visiting <span class="line"><!---->PDFs on desktop load in a GuestView, which has an inner WebContents separate from the top-level WebContents.  Normally, though, navigations in a PDF get intercepted and targeted at the top-level WebContents, causing the entire inner WebContents to go away rather than navigate.  You can verify this by clicking the link in the PDF after visiting <!----></span>https://lbstyle.github.io/chromeUrls.pdf<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://lbstyle.github.io/chromeUrls.pdf"><!---->https://lbstyle.github.io/chromeUrls.pdf<!----></a> in a normal tab.<span class="line"><!----> in a normal tab.<!----></span><br><br>I'm curious why that isn't happening in the Payments WebContents.  Agreed that it should be fixed, and it may make sense to block PDFs entirely within the Payments WebContents to be safe on top of that.<span class="line"><!---->I'm curious why that isn't happening in the Payments WebContents.  Agreed that it should be fixed, and it may make sense to block PDFs entirely within the Payments WebContents to be safe on top of that.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        Note that blocking PDFs in Payments WebContents may be useful, but I suspect this bug would also apply to many other non-tab WebContents use cases, so it may not be sufficient.<span class="line"><!---->Note that blocking PDFs in Payments WebContents may be useful, but I suspect this bug would also apply to many other non-tab WebContents use cases, so it may not be sufficient.<!----></span><br><br>I'm curious if the PDF extension's approach for handling navigations within the PDF needs to be hardened to not rely on the embedder.  For example, kmoon@ points to this code as one place that might be involved:<span class="line"><!---->I'm curious if the PDF extension's approach for handling navigations within the PDF needs to be hardened to not rely on the embedder.  For example, kmoon@ points to this code as one place that might be involved:<!----></span><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:extensions/browser/guest_view/mime_handler_view/mime_handler_view_guest.cc;l=253;drc=df7b5e3cc781f29d798ff7dad2f74fbec88d292d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:extensions/browser/guest_view/mime_handler_view/mime_handler_view_guest.cc;l=253;drc=df7b5e3cc781f29d798ff7dad2f74fbec88d292d"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:extensions/browser/guest_view/mime_handler_view/mime_handler_view_guest.cc;l=253;drc=df7b5e3cc781f29d798ff7dad2f74fbec88d292d<!----></a><br><br>WebContents* MimeHandlerViewGuest::OpenURLFromTab(<span class="line"><!---->WebContents* MimeHandlerViewGuest::OpenURLFromTab(<!----></span><br>    WebContents* source,<span class="line"><!---->    WebContents* source,<!----></span><br>    const content::OpenURLParams& params) {<span class="line"><!---->    const content::OpenURLParams&amp; params) {<!----></span><br>  auto* delegate = embedder_web_contents()->GetDelegate();<span class="line"><!---->  auto* delegate = embedder_web_contents()-&gt;GetDelegate();<!----></span><br>  return delegate ? delegate->OpenURLFromTab(embedder_web_contents(), params)<span class="line"><!---->  return delegate ? delegate-&gt;OpenURLFromTab(embedder_web_contents(), params)<!----></span><br>                  : nullptr;<span class="line"><!---->                  : nullptr;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>If we're depending on the WebContentsDelegate and non-standard cases like Payments don't pass it to the outer WebContents but somehow let it happen in the inner WebContents, that would be a problem.  (I'm not entirely sure if that's what's happening here.)<span class="line"><!---->If we're depending on the WebContentsDelegate and non-standard cases like Payments don't pass it to the outer WebContents but somehow let it happen in the inner WebContents, that would be a problem.  (I'm not entirely sure if that's what's happening here.)<!----></span><br><br>I'll also point to navigator.js as another place that we've seen issues in the past:<span class="line"><!---->I'll also point to navigator.js as another place that we've seen issues in the past:<!----></span><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/resources/pdf/navigator.js;drc=a9c450d1237c78cfcf93603697c9972f7adf5187;l=105<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/resources/pdf/navigator.js;drc=a9c450d1237c78cfcf93603697c9972f7adf5187;l=105"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/resources/pdf/navigator.js;drc=a9c450d1237c78cfcf93603697c9972f7adf5187;l=105<!----></a><br>(For example, this came up in security bugs like <span class="line"><!---->(For example, this came up in security bugs like <!----></span>issue 851821<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=851821" title="Security: Chrome PDF reader has no restrictions/user confirmation on URI action"><!---->issue 851821<!----></a> and<span class="line"><!----> and<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>issue 852716<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=852716" title="Security: Chromium PDF reader automatically opens URL through PDF URI tag"><!---->issue 852716<!----></a>.)<span class="line"><!---->.)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        That navigator.js code does look suspicious:<span class="line"><!---->That navigator.js code does look suspicious:<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/resources/pdf/navigator.js;drc=a9c450d1237c78cfcf93603697c9972f7adf5187;l=43<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/resources/pdf/navigator.js;drc=a9c450d1237c78cfcf93603697c9972f7adf5187;l=43"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/resources/pdf/navigator.js;drc=a9c450d1237c78cfcf93603697c9972f7adf5187;l=43<!----></a><br><br>  navigateInCurrentTab: function(url) {<span class="line"><!---->  navigateInCurrentTab: function(url) {<!----></span><br>    // When the PDFviewer is inside a browser tab, prefer the tabs API because<span class="line"><!---->    // When the PDFviewer is inside a browser tab, prefer the tabs API because<!----></span><br>    // it can navigate from one file:// URL to another.<span class="line"><!---->    // it can navigate from one file:// URL to another.<!----></span><br>    if (chrome.tabs && this.tabId_ != -1)<span class="line"><!---->    if (chrome.tabs &amp;&amp; this.tabId_ != -1)<!----></span><br>      chrome.tabs.update(this.tabId_, {url: url});<span class="line"><!---->      chrome.tabs.update(this.tabId_, {url: url});<!----></span><br>    else<span class="line"><!---->    else<!----></span><br>      window.location.href = url;<span class="line"><!---->      window.location.href = url;<!----></span><br>  },<span class="line"><!---->  },<!----></span><br><br><br>If the conditional fails, then we hit the window.location.href = url line, which is a recipe for this URL spoof.  Probably dates back to <span class="line"><!---->If the conditional fails, then we hit the window.location.href = url line, which is a recipe for this URL spoof.  Probably dates back to <!----></span>https://codereview.chromium.org/2300243004<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://codereview.chromium.org/2300243004"><!---->https://codereview.chromium.org/2300243004<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>I wonder if PDF folks can remove that else, first of all.  We probably never want to navigate the inner WebContents.  Whether chrome.tabs should work in the Payments case is a separate question, and it may be that we don't want it to.<span class="line"><!---->I wonder if PDF folks can remove that else, first of all.  We probably never want to navigate the inner WebContents.  Whether chrome.tabs should work in the Payments case is a separate question, and it may be that we don't want it to.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

        The decision as to whether or not a URL is opened as a PDF isn't made until the URL response headers (Content-Type) are received. (We don't know the true MIME type of the response until this point; actually, we even sniff a few bytes of the response body in some cases.) WillStartRequest() is too early in the navigation flow to detect if you're navigating to a PDF. (The request hasn't been issued yet.)<span class="line"><!---->The decision as to whether or not a URL is opened as a PDF isn't made until the URL response headers (Content-Type) are received. (We don't know the true MIME type of the response until this point; actually, we even sniff a few bytes of the response body in some cases.) WillStartRequest() is too early in the navigation flow to detect if you're navigating to a PDF. (The request hasn't been issued yet.)<!----></span><br><br>For example, see PDFIFrameNavigationThrottle and PluginResponseInterceptorURLLoaderThrottle.<span class="line"><!---->For example, see PDFIFrameNavigationThrottle and PluginResponseInterceptorURLLoaderThrottle.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        Ah, turns out I should use WillProcessResponse() instead. navigation_handle()->GetResponseHeaders()->GetMimeType(&mime_type)  returns the right type.<span class="line"><!---->Ah, turns out I should use WillProcessResponse() instead. navigation_handle()-&gt;GetResponseHeaders()-&gt;GetMimeType(&amp;mime_type)  returns the right type.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        One more thing: The PDF viewer actually isn't the only extension that makes use of MimeHandlerView and its associated infrastructure. It's also used by the (formerly) QuickOffice extension (used to view Office file types), so it might be worthwhile to make sure a similar issue can't occur with that extension.<span class="line"><!---->One more thing: The PDF viewer actually isn't the only extension that makes use of MimeHandlerView and its associated infrastructure. It's also used by the (formerly) QuickOffice extension (used to view Office file types), so it might be worthwhile to make sure a similar issue can't occur with that extension.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        You probably want to check if the MIME type would be handled by an extension. This is the most "future proof" approach.<span class="line"><!---->You probably want to check if the MIME type would be handled by an extension. This is the most "future proof" approach.<!----></span><br><br>There's an allow list of extensions that are allowed to register MIME type handlers:<span class="line"><!---->There's an allow list of extensions that are allowed to register MIME type handlers:<!----></span><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:extensions/common/manifest_handlers/mime_types_handler.cc;l=29;drc=06805e7f64715706c1cf0dad0b04f481b0eda70c<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:extensions/common/manifest_handlers/mime_types_handler.cc;l=29;drc=06805e7f64715706c1cf0dad0b04f481b0eda70c"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:extensions/common/manifest_handlers/mime_types_handler.cc;l=29;drc=06805e7f64715706c1cf0dad0b04f481b0eda70c<!----></a><br><br>I would take a step back and ask if this is the right approach, though. Maybe allow listing specific navigations is what you really want, rather than banning certain kinds of navigations? Or we can just fix the bug in the PDF viewer.<span class="line"><!---->I would take a step back and ask if this is the right approach, though. Maybe allow listing specific navigations is what you really want, rather than banning certain kinds of navigations? Or we can just fix the bug in the PDF viewer.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
